tagline: Writes firmware for constrained hardware — every byte counted, every microsecond budgeted
pros: Deep bare-metal C/C++ on ARM, ESP32, AVR, and RISC-V
Real-time systems expertise with hard timing guarantees
Bridges hardware and software — reads datasheets and oscilloscope traces
Production hardening with watchdogs, OTA updates, and graceful degradation
cons: Highly specialized — not transferable to web or business software
Hardware dependency means slower iteration than pure software projects
Conservative approach may resist higher-level abstractions that are safe in context
